allowErrors.desc: Default is false. Keeping this off will render all template parsing and compiling errors straight to the template output. If true, errors will be thrown straight to the Node.js process, potentially crashing your application.

autoescape.desc: Automatically escape all variable output. This is the default behavior and it is highly recommended to leave this on. For character conversion tables, see the escape filter.

values.true: Will escape output safe for HTML.
values.false: Will not escape any output unless forced via the escape filter or autoescape tag.
values.'js': Will escape output safe for JavaScript.

cache.desc: Changing this to false will re-compile the template files for each request. It is recommended to leave this as true for production use.

encoding.desc: The character encoding for template files.

filters.desc: Use this to set any custom filters and/or override any of the built-in filters. For more information on writing your own filters, see the custom filters guide.

root.desc: The directory to search for templates. If a template passed to swig.compileFile is an absolute path (starts with /), Swig will not look in the template root.

tags.desc: Use this to set any custom tags and/or override any of the built-in tags. For more information on writing your own tags, see the custom tags guide.

extensions.desc: Add library extensions that will be available to compiled templates. For more information, see the custom tags guide on third party extensions.

tzOffset.desc: Sets a default timezone offset, in minutes from GMT. Setting this will make the date filter automatically convert dates parsed through the date filter to the appropriate timezone offset.

add.title: add(value)
add.desc: Adds the value to the variable. Strings that can be converted to integers will be summed, not concatenated, as in the example below.

args.name: value
args.desc: The value to add to the variable before printing it to the page. Accepts any array, object, number, and string.

addslashes.title: addslashes
addslashes.desc: Returns a string with backslashes in front of characters that need to be quoted for database queries, etc.

capitalize.title: capitalize
capitalize.desc: Capitalize the first character in the string.

date.title: date(format[, tzOffset])
date.desc: Convert a valid date into a format as specified. Mostly conforms to php.net's date formatting.

args.name: format
args.desc: The format to convert the date to. See the date formatting table for formatting options.

args.name: tzOffset
args.desc: The timezone offset in minutes from GMT to display the date in.

default.title: default(value)
default.desc: If the variable is undefined, null, or false, a default return value can be specified.

args.name: value
args.desc: Fallback value if the variable is falsy.

escape.title: escape([type])
escape.desc: Force escape the output of the variable. Optionally use e as a shortcut filter name. This filter will be applied by default if autoescape is turned on.

args.name: type
args.desc: If you pass the string <samp>js</samp> in as the type, output will be escaped so that it is safe for JavaScript execution.

first.title: first
first.desc: Returns the first element of an array.

join.title: join(glue)
join.desc: If the value is an Array, you can join each value with a delimiter and return it as a string.

args.name: glue
args.desc: Concatenation string to join each item in the array with.

json_encode.title: json_encode([indent])
json_encode.desc: Return a json-encoded string of the input.

args.name: indent
args.desc: If greater than zero, the JSON will be pretty-printed using the number of spaces specified by the

last.title: last
last.desc: Returns the last element of an array.

length.title: length
length.desc: Return the length property of the input. If the input is an object, returns the number of keys on the object.

lower.title: lower
lower.desc: Return the input in all lowercase letters.

raw.title: raw
raw.desc: Forces the input to not be auto-escaped.

replace.title: replace(search, replace[, flags])
replace.desc: Uses built-in JavaScript replace method. Provide a regular-expression or a string and a replacement string.

args.name: search
args.desc: string or regular expression to find

args.name: replace
args.desc: string that will replace the matched parts from <var>search</var>

reverse.title: reverse
reverse.desc: If the input value is an Array, this filter will reverse all items in the array.

title.title: title
title.desc: Change the output to title-case: the first letter of every word will be uppercase, while all the rest will be lowercase.

uniq.title: uniq
uniq.desc: Produces a duplicate-free version of an input array.

upper.title: upper
upper.desc: Change the output to all uppercase letters.

url_encode.title: url_encode
url_encode.desc: Encode the ouput as a URI component.

url_decode.title: url_decode
url_decode.desc: Decode the ouput as a URI component.

extends.desc: Makes the current template extend a parent template. This tag must be the first item in your template.

file.desc:
The path, relative to the template root, to use as the parent layout for the current file. Must be the first token of this file.

See Template inheritance for more information.

block.desc:
Defines a block in a template that can be overridden by a template extending this one and/or will override the current template's parent template block of the same name.

See Template inheritance for more information.

name.desc: Name for the current block context. Must start with a letter and only include letters, numbers, and underscores.

parent.desc:
Inject the content from the parent template's block of the same name into the current block.

See Template inheritance for more information.

include.desc: Includes a template in it's place. The template is rendered within the current context.

file.desc: The path, relative to the template root, to render into the current context.

ignore missing.desc: Do not error if the file does not exist.

with <var>x</var>.desc: Set <var>x</var> to the root context object to pass to the rendering of the template. This should always be a key:value object.

only.desc: Restrict the context of the template to those explicitly defined the the <var>with x</var> argument

raw.desc: Stop token parsing within this tag. All content will be output as-is.

x.desc: Loop-accessible name for the current loop iteration's value.

in.desc: The literal token 'in' is a required token.

y.desc: Iterable object. Can be modified with filters as desired.

....desc: Accepts any valid JavaScript conditional statement, as well as some other human readable syntaxes.

autoescape.desc: Change the current behavior of variable auto-escaping.

on.desc: Whether the content should be escaped (<samp>true</samp>) or not (<samp>false</samp>).

set.desc: Set a variable for re-use in the current context.

name.desc: Variable name to assign the value to.

=.desc: The literal equals sign is a required token.

macro.desc: Create custom, reusable snippets within your templates.

import.desc: Allows you to import macros from another file directly into your current context.

file.desc: The path, relative to the template root, to import macros from.

as.desc: The literal token 'as' is a required token.

var.desc: Context-accessible object name to assign the macros to.

filter.desc: Apply a filter to an entire block of template.

filter_name.desc: Name of the filter to use.

....desc: Accepts any number of arguments, will be passed to the filter.
